p: Remote sensing methods offer great prospects for rapid and noninvasive monitoring of rare and endangered plant species. Various types and combinations of sensors are used for this purpose [ 120, 121, 122, 123]. The most promising is hyperspectral cameras [ 124], which can receive multiple frames of the same scene in different adjacent ranges of the electromagnetic spectrum. Today, there are many approaches to using hyperspectral survey data to identify the species of agricultural, woody, and other plant species and varieties [ 125, 126].
